intro: Phyllanthus proctoris, commonly known as the proctor's spurge, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family, characterized by its unique floral structures and milky sap. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a waxy coating, while its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia. Phyllanthus proctoris is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates, thriving in well-drained soils and full sunlight.
